Sri Mulyani Ungkap Tempat 'Siluman' untuk Tilap Dana Desa
04 Nov 2019, 19:53 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani. (CNN Indonesia/Michael Josua Stefanus)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati mengungkapkan kementeriannya mendapatkan laporan bahwa Dana Desa diselewengkan. Penyelewengan dilakukan dengan modus; menyalurkan Dana Desa ke desa baru yang tak berpenghuni.Ia mengatakan semenjak Dana Desa digelontorkan, banyak desa baru yang bermunculan. Tapi setelah dicek,  nyatanya tak berpenghuni. Ia menduga desa tak berpenghuni tersebut sengaja diciptakan demi mendapatkan dana pemerintah. Sri mengatakan kabar  soal keberadaan desa tak berpenghuni tersebut baru didengarnya dari Kementerian Dalam Negeri.Kabar diterima kementeriannya usai Presiden Jokowi mengumumkan kabinet barunya beberapa waktu lalu. "Kami mendengar beberapa masukkan karena adanya transfer yang 'ajeg' dari APBN, maka sekarang muncul desa-desa baru yang bahkan tidak ada penduduknya. Hanya untuk bisa mendapatkan (dana desa)," kata Sri di rapat kerja (raker) dengan Komisi XI DPR, Jakarta, Senin (4/11). Namun, Sri tidak menyebutkan secara pasti berapa banyak ataupun nama, dan lokasi desa fiktif tersebut. Ia hanya mengatakan agar masalah tersebut tidak berulang, pihaknya akan memperketat penyaluran Dana Desa.Selain itu, pihaknya juga akan menyelidiki mekanisme pembentukan desa, dan identifikasi jumlahnya, lokasi, susunan pengurusnya. "Kami akan lakukan verifikasi terhadap munculnya fenomena tersebut," katanya.Pemerintah sejak beberapa tahun belakangan ini menggelontorkan Dana Desa untuk menggenjot pembangunan di daerah. Tercatat, sampai dengan 2019 ini, total dana yang sudah disalurkan ke desa mencapai Rp257 triliun. Meskipun demikian, Sri Mulyani mengatakan keberadaan dana tersebut masih belum banyak mengurangi desa yang tertinggal di Indonesia. "Walaupun kita sudah berikan setiap tahunnya, kita masih banyak lihat desa, sekitar 20 ribu yang masih kategori desa tertinggal," ungkapnya. (ara/agt)

Sri Mulyani Said 'Siluman' Place for Tilap Dana Desa
04 Nov 2019, 19:53 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani. (CNN Indonesia / Michael Josua Stefanus)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati revealed his ministry received a report that the Village Fund was misused. Deviation is done by mode; channeling the Village Fund to new uninhabited villages. He said that since the Village Fund was released, many new villages have sprung up. But after checking, in fact uninhabited. He suspects the uninhabited village was deliberately created in order to get government funds. Sri said that the news about the existence of the uninhabited village had only been heard from the Ministry of the Interior. The ministry received the ministry after President Jokowi announced his new cabinet some time ago. "We heard some input because of the 'steady' transfers from the state budget, so now new villages are emerging that don't even have residents. Only to be able to get (village funds)," Sri said at a working meeting (Raker) with the House Commission XI , Jakarta, Monday (4/11). However, Sri did not specify how many or the names and locations of the fictitious villages. He only said that so that the problem would not recur, his party would tighten the distribution of the Village Fund. In addition, it would also investigate the mechanism of village formation, and identify the amount, location, and composition of its management. "We will verify the emergence of this phenomenon," he said. The government has for the past few years poured out the Village Fund to boost development in the regions. Noted, up to 2019, the total funds that have been distributed to villages reached Rp257 trillion. Even so, Sri Mulyani said the existence of these funds still had not reduced much of the villages left behind in Indonesia. "Even though we have given it every year, we still see many villages, around 20 thousand are still underdeveloped villages," he said. (fig / aug)
